intro: Warrea tricolor, commonly known as the three-colored warrea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its strikingly colorful flowers, which typically display three distinct colors on each bloom. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it thrives in warm, humid climates with well-drained soil. Warrea tricolor is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
